title: Adding a Mail.ru Email Account in Thunderbird x32
content: Hello, I am having an issue with adding an email account to Thunderbird (x32). I enter my full name, email address, and app-specific password. Thunderbird recognizes the password, but when I click "Next," I get the following message: "Unable to log in to the server. There may be an error in the configuration, username, or password." I expect a window to appear for additional authorization through mail.ru since I am using OAuth2 authentication, but this window does not pop up. Interestingly, on another computer with the same version, I can add this account without any issues. Additionally, the account is added successfully on the same computer with the newer version, but for some reason, it does not add on the x32 version. Although the account does get added if I use the "normal password" option, I cannot send messages from it. I look forward to your response and assistance. Thank you in advance!

title: Automatic profile backup
content:
Hello, I would like to backup my whole Thunderbird profile every day (or at least every week) automatic, and I didn't find any workful solution for it. The problem is, that I have only POP3 protocol and Inbox file brakes, if there is any new message while copying. Unfortunately, I can't move my mail to IMAP, it's not a variant. Automatic closing Thunderbird (like in crontab killing process) before backup is not a variant either, because it's not safe. Manual closing Thunderbird would solve my problem, but, as I said, I need to do it automatic). For example, If I am absent for a few weeks, backup should continue working fine. If anyone have already found working solution for it?

P.S. ImportExportTools NG "Automatic backup" is not automatic, you need to close Thunderbird manually every day for this to work.

title: Email automatica (OOO) impazzita
content:
Buongiorno,

la settimana dal 12 al 18 agosto l'agenzia per il quale lavoro era chiusa e per cui ho impostato il filtro automatico come risposta. Tuttavia, scoprendo poi un metodo alternativo passando dalla web email, ho cancellato il messaggio senza mai attivarlo e ciononostante continua ad essere inviato a caso, senza che mi scrivano o io scriva a loro.

Adesso ho cancellato ogni modello, ogni filtro, sia sull'app che sulla web email e il messaggio continua ad essere inviato.

Non so più cosa fare, voi sapreste dirmi cosa non sta funzionando? Temo sia un virus.

In attesa di un vostro feedback vi auguro una buona giornata, Danny

title: gmail passkey support with bitwarden
content:
Good morning. it is strange that nobody reported yet that exist huge issue with Thunderbird and Gmail passkey support. Well in a moment you login to gmail it ask for passkey in popup browser window. But Thunderbird does not have bitwarden extension and not have any add-ons which support passkey. So it feels that Thunderbird not usable at all in case if used google passkey. It is also do not exist way to install firefox browser addon to Thunderbird internal browser. So i have a questions. 1) is it possible somehow to install firefox addon to thunderbird internal browser. 2) Is it possible to use normal system wide browser instead of internal thunderbird browser for authentication. 3) Do exist any workaround how to use bitwarden with thunderbird for passkeys

PS: I am also seen in internet people also have this problem and seen in bitwarden feature request to make it thunderbird compatible. But it was closed as not related to bitwarden but related to thunderbird problem.

title: Profile reset
content:
Hello,

My Thunderbird just reset itself.

My profile and account settings were there. All my emails and filters were gone (maybe other things too that I am not aware of). Even the vertical spacing of emails changed and the descending order reverted back to the default ascending order (is there a global setting to list everything in descending order?).

I had an old backup zip file (500+ Mb) which I imported (more than once) but the backup emails are not showing after import>restart.

This is my office email account. Since working from home the old emails are needed and now they are all gone. All client updates and HR emails, everything :(

Is there any way to download all emails from the server again? Or at least have the imported messages show up again so I can get a partial backup?

Thanks.

title: Thunderbird can no longer access my Gmail account
content:
Thunderbird v.128.1.1esr (64-bit) (up to date) Windows 11 Pro v.23H2 OS Build 22631.4037 No VPN

Two days ago my Thunderbird installation stopped being able to access my Gmail account. Everything was working fine up until then. Now I get a notice to allow Thunderbird to access Gmail, I click 'Allow' and it fails to authenticate. Collecting mail from my other non-Gmail accounts is unaffected and works fine.

I see these permission approvals are triggering email alerts to my backup Gmail account for this one re: "A new sign-in on Windows" and I am consistently clicking "Yes it was me'" with no effect. I have not done anything to block this activity, and I have no problem logging into this Gmail account from any web browser using the same credentials I am using with Thunderbird ... and which were already in place when this started happening 2 days ago.

I checked in Thunderbird Settings > Privacy & Security and cookies are being accepted, and I can see the cookies in the list.

I have tried deleting the saved (unchanged) password, removing the cookies, and even removing the account and setting it up again, with no joy.

When re-setting up the account this morning, the account creation does not complete and I am receiving this notice: "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password." (see attached screenshot)

The username and password were (a) unchanged from 3 days ago when this worked fine and (2) confirmed as I can log in to that Gmail account just fine with any web browser using the same credentials, even with incognito browser.

Thinking maybe the Thunderbird auto-detected configuration is incorrect, I changed the IMAP Connection Secutiry setting for the account from SSL/TLS to STARTTLS where it took about 2 minutes on the Checking Password stage and ultimately failed with the same error message.

TIA for any assistance with being able to use Thunderbird once again to work with this Gmail account.
creator: stupidscript

title: Thunderbird on Pop OS toolbar
content:
I run Pop OS 22.04, and use Thunderbird.

I long ago set up Thunderbird to launch from the Pop OS toolbar. I marked Thunderbird as a "Favorite", so it has an icon on the toolbar, and launches from there. When a program marked as a Favorite is running, the toolbar displays a white dot beneath the icon.

I ran a Pop OS update, and Thunderbird updated to 128.0.1esr. (I'm not sure what version existed before, but I stay very current with Pop OS updates.) With that update, launching worked, but:

- The running Thunderbird process was represented by a second occurrence of the icon on the toolbar, and that one had the white dot.

- If I remove the old favorite, then the new Thunderbird process (started from a shell) cannot be made into a Favorite, so I don't know how to get the icon back on the toolbar.

In other words, something about integration with Pop OS changed, and I no longer see how to add Thunderbird back to it. I asked System76 support about this, and they suggested I pursue the issue here.

content: After years of working fine, Thunderbird suddenly won't download new messages (from Yahoo.com). Thunderbird says it's "Folder is being processed" or "checking for new messages," but it never downloads them. I can see my messages by going to Yahoo but I want them in Thunderbird. It's been a month and I'm out of ideas. It happens with both computers in the house, different versions of Windows, Thunderbird, and different anti-virus software.

title: bug report- message content does not always match header
content:
using the 'quick filter' feature of mozilla thunderbird version 128.1.1esr (64-bit) i was able to locate the message i was searching for in the top section (message list headers pane) but when i selected the correct message header, the contents that were displayed were from a different unrelated message.

in researching this issue i discovered that the message content for three separate messages now are displaying with the content from the same incorrect message. (the incorrect message content is a photo from an escape room, the three other messages should all be mostly text)

i assume there is a fix like rebuilding the index or something but this should not have happened in the first place so i'd like to report this as a bug.

pls let me know if i can provide any further information to help track this down if you want. happy Monday - NN

title: Removed account still asks for sign in
content: I had a school gmail account in thunderbird that I no longer have access to because I graduated. Once I lost access to the account, thunderbird would repeatedly ask me to sign in, so I removed the account through account settings -> account actions -> remove account. However thunderbird still repeatedly requests me to sign into the removed account. The account is no longer visible in the account settings sidebar, and I've also removed the account from my outgoing server settings, and from my saved passwords, but it still asks to be to signed in. This is preventing thunderbird from automatically updating emails, since whenever it checks for new messages it gets stuck on the removed account.
creator: creepinator45

title: Repeated error "MODIFICATION_FAILED" when using CalDAV calendar offline
content:
Hi, I've been using CalDAV on my Synology server to synch between my desktop Thunderbird instance and handheld without problems. I recently added my laptop as a third platform which synched fine. However now I am working offline (I have an Internet connection but no remote access to Synology), Thunderbird repeatedly comes up with the message:

An error occurred when writing to the calendar My Calendar! Please see below for more information. Error code: MODIFICATION_FAILED.

The error message is maximally annoying as it steals focus from all Thunderbird windows then hides in the background, making it look like the app has disappeared entirely.

I have Offline Support checked in the calendar properties. Platform: Windows 11. I've tried deleting calender_date\cache.sqlte as suggested elsewhere but that makes all my appointment disappear.
creator: steve017
